articles.author: Ajeng Dinar Ulfiana
articles.description: Pasijah, a 55-year-old housewife in Indonesia's Central Java province, wakes up every morning to the sound of the sea. If that sounds idyllic, it is anything but.
articles.title: Indonesian woman turns to mangroves to fend off rising tides

articles.author: Bart Meijer, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Rubio's comments underline mounting frustrations in the White House over a lack of progress in pushes to settle a growing list of geopolitical challenges.
articles.title: US will abandon Ukraine peace efforts if no progress made soon, Rubio says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. strikes on a fuel port in Yemen killed at least 38 people on Thursday, Houthi-run media said, one of the deadliest days since the United States began its attacks on the Iran-backed militants.
articles.title: US strike on Yemen fuel port kills at least 38, Houthi media say

articles.author: Hannah Lang, Judith Langowski
articles.description: Last week, a pack of rice crackers at Sun Vin Grocery store on Mulberry Street in New York City’s Chinatown cost $4.99.
articles.title: Insight: In US Chinatowns, merchants ‘don’t want the trade war to be a war’

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Republican U.S. President Donald Trump's White House launched a COVID-19 website on Friday in which it blamed the origins of the coronavirus on a lab leak in China while criticizing Democratic former President Joe Biden, former top U.S. health official Anthony Fauci and the World Health Organization.
articles.title: Trump's White House launches COVID website that criticizes WHO, Fauci and Biden

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people found dead after a boat accident in Congo has risen to 148, Sky News reported on Friday, citing officials.
articles.title: At least 148 people die after boat catches fire in Congo, Sky News reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military will consolidate its presence in Syria over the coming weeks and months in a move that could reduce the number of troops it has in the country by half, chief Pentagon spokesperson Sean Parnell said on Friday.
articles.title: US military to slash troops in Syria to under 1,000

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 12 people were killed in an attack in Ecuador's coastal province of Manabi, police said on Friday.
articles.title: At least 12 killed in an attack in Ecuador's Manabi province

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is prepared to recognize Russian control of the Ukrainian region of Crimea as part of a broader peace agreement between Moscow and Kyiv, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: US open to recognizing Crimea as Russian in Ukraine deal, Bloomberg News reports

articles.author: Wa Lone
articles.description: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney said that China is one of the largest threats with respect to foreign interference in Canada and is an emerging threat in the Arctic.
articles.title: Carney says China is a foreign interference, geopolitical threat for Canada
